properties.label: Route I — Indian Ocean → Atlantic Labor Circuits
properties.echo: A symbolic empire-and-labor corridor: South Asian maritime work, coercion, and post-abolition indenture feeding Atlantic plantation and port economies.

properties.label: Route II — West Africa → Caribbean
properties.echo: A core transatlantic corridor: forced transport into plantation worlds—memory carried across saltwater.

properties.label: Route III — Mississippi → Chicago
properties.echo: The Great Migration: leaving the plantation economy, building northern cities, and remaking culture and politics (c. 1920s–1970s).

properties.label: Route IV — Maroon Corridor (Bayous & Wetlands)
properties.echo: Refusal routes: maroon survival in wetlands—kinship, camouflage, and self-determination beyond the plantation’s reach.
